channel.title: PhpMyAdmin
channel.description: Where are the databases located in the files on Ubuntu 11.04, usin Xampp from highscores tutorial. I need this, because I can't login to my phpmyadmin for some reason. I'm using the right password and username and everything, but it just says [code]This webpage is not available The webpage at http://localhost/phpmyadmin might be temporarily down or it may have moved permanently to a new web address. Error 15 (net::ERR_SOCKET_NOT_CONNECTED): Unknown error.[/code] So, if someone can direct me to them, I would much appreciate it. I have to folders that are phpmyadmin in the lampp folder, "phpmyadmin", and "phpsqliteadmin." The thing is that I don't see any of my databases in it.

I use lampp, and I’ve tried every browser.

C:\wamp\bin\mysql\mysql5.5.8\data\DATABASE_NAME

item.title: PhpMyAdmin
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

that has nothing to do with a username or password problem.

I have no problem with my password and username. Well, it works fine with my server, it connects just fine. But, when I try to login to phpmyadmin with the same username and password, it just goes to the this webpage is not available page. I don’t have my sql tables written down or anything, so… That’s why I need to get the tables. I’m trying to add more tables and stuff, but I can’t. Plus I have to remove something.

Read full topic

item.title: PhpMyAdmin
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Where are the databases located in the files on Ubuntu 11.04, usin Xampp from highscores tutorial. I need this, because I can’t login to my phpmyadmin for some reason. I’m using the right password and username and everything, but it just says This webpage is not available The webpage at http://localhost/phpmyadmin might be temporarily down or it may have moved permanently to a new web address. Error 15 (net::ERR_SOCKET_NOT_CONNECTED): Unknown error.
So, if someone can direct me to them, I would much appreciate it. I have to folders that are phpmyadmin in the lampp folder, “phpmyadmin”, and “phpsqliteadmin.” The thing is that I don’t see any of my databases in it.

Read full topic
